p: To understand why only the early 20 th century generated all epidemic HIVs, we aimed to reveal the full spectrum of factors that might have had the potential to increase SIV/HIV transmissibility and adaptation in the established critical time interval. In order to be consistent with a causal relationship, the factor or factors responsible should coincide both spatially and temporally with the origin of the epidemic [39], and thus should have peaked in early 20 th century in the geographic areas coinciding more or less with the ranges of the relevant SIV-carrying primates.
